--- title: HandyDict keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "A class that acts as a wrapper for a `dict` that also implements the functions `apply_keyed` and `return_keyed`." description: "A class that acts as a wrapper for a `dict` that also implements the functions `apply_keyed` and `return_keyed`." ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
class HandyDict(UserDict):
    
    def __getitem__(self, key):
        if isinstance(key, list):
            return return_keyed(self.data, key)
        else:
            return self.data[key]
        
    def apply(self, keys, action, ignore_non_existing=True):
        return HandyDict(apply_keyed(self.data, keys, action, ignore_non_existing))
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class HandyDict[source]

HandyDict(*args, **kwargs) :: UserDict

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
test_dict = {
    'A': {
        'B': [
            {'C': 1},
            {'C': 2},
            {'C': 3},
        ]
    }
}

handy_dict = HandyDict(test_dict)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert handy_dict[["A","B","C"]] == [1, 2, 3]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert handy_dict["A"]["B"] == [{'C': 1}, {'C': 2}, {'C': 3}]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def add_one(value):
    return value + 1
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
result_dict = handy_dict.apply(["A","B","C"], add_one)
assert result_dict[["A","B","C"]] == [2, 3, 4]
{% endraw %}
